'amino-terminus', 'NH 2-terminus', 'N-terminal end' or 'amine-
terminus') refers to the start of a protein or polypeptide terminated by an
amino acid with a free amine group (-NH 2). The convention for writing
peptide sequences is to put the N-terminus on the left and write the sequence
from N- to C-terminus. When the protein is translated from messenger RNA, it is
created from N-terminus to C-terminus.
